intro: Eleocharis squamata, commonly known as the flat-spike sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swampy areas and shallow water. The plant has grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish colonies in suitable habitats. Eleocharis squamata plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
